title: Mastering AI Product Descriptions & SEO
author: Ekobol Content Team
image_alt: AI content generation and SEO optimization workflow
image_caption: Write converting copy at scale with AI-powered NLP.
p1: Great product descriptions do two things: they rank on Google (SEO) and they convince humans to buy (Conversion). Ekobol's AI Writer is trained on millions of high-converting e-commerce listings to achieve both. This guide teaches you how to steer the AI for maximum impact.
p2: Access the writer via Products → [Select Product] → AI Description tab.
li2_text: Bullet points of raw facts (e.g., 'Lumbar support, breathable mesh, 120kg capacity').
li3_text: Terms you want to rank for (e.g., 'home office', 'back pain relief').
li4_text: The personality of the text (Professional, Luxury, playful, Urgent).
p3: Matching the tone to your target audience increases trust and conversion.
li5_text: Best for B2B, industrial equipment, or medical supplies. Focuses on specs, reliability, and precision.
li6_text: Best for jewelry, fashion, or high-end decor. Uses sensory language ('velvet touch', 'exquisite craftsmanship').
li7_text: Best for gadgets, toys, or clearance items. Uses power words ('revolutionary', 'limited time', 'must-have').
li8_text: Best for sustainable products. Emphasizes organic materials, ethical sourcing, and nature.
p4: One size does not fit all. The AI adapts the structure based on the destination.
li10_text: Structure: 5 bullet points, each starting with a capitalized benefit.
li11_text: Example: 'MAXIMUM COMFORT: features high-density memory foam...'
li13_text: Structure: Catchy opening hook + emoji usage + strong Call to Action (CTA).
li14_text: Example: 'Transform your workspace ✨ Work smarter, not harder... Link in bio!'
li16_text: Structure: H1 Title, engaging intro paragraph, H2 benefits section, technical specs table.
p5: Don't key-stuff; weave them in naturally.
li17_text: Include in the Title and the first sentence of the description.
li18_text: The AI automatically suggests semantically related terms (e.g., if selling 'Sneakers', it adds 'running shoes', 'athletic footwear').
li19_text: Aim for 1-2% density. Overuse triggers spam filters.
li20_text: Ekobol translates AND localizes. It doesn't just swap words; it adjusts cultural nuances.
li21_text: Example: 'Comfortable trainers' for UK vs 'Comfortable sneakers' for US.
li22_text: Always review auto-translated content for technical accuracy.
p7: Don't guess what sells; test it.
li23_text: Generate Version A (Luxury Tone) and Version B (Benefit-Driven Tone).
li24_text: Run Version A for 2 weeks, then Version B for 2 weeks.
li25_text: Compare Conversion Rate and CTR (Click-Through Rate).
p8: AI is the drafter; you are the editor.
li26_text: Check for 'Hallucinations': Ensure the AI didn't invent features your product doesn't have.
li27_text: Break up long paragraphs: Mobile users hate walls of text.
li28_text: Add brand-specific formatting: Bold key phrases to guide the eye.
li29_text: Don't just say '2000mAh battery'. Say 'Lasts all day on a single charge'.
li30_text: Use the description to answer common questions (e.g., 'Is it machine washable? Yes!').
li31_text: Mention 'Trusted by 10,000+ customers' if factually true.
p9: Save your best prompts as templates.
li32_text: Create 'Holiday Sale Template' for seasonal updates.
li33_text: Create 'Technical Spec Sheet' for industrial products.
li34_text: Text too short? Increase the 'Output Length' slider.
li35_text: Text too repetitive? Increase 'Temperature' setting for more creativity.
help_text: Ready to write copy that converts?
